intro: Crotalaria dilloniana f. camerunensis, commonly known as the Cameroon crotalaria, is a flowering plant native to Cameroon. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in open woodland or grassland habitats. It has compound leaves and produces pods that contain seeds, which are dispersed by wind or animals. This species is of interest in botanical studies due to its ecological role and potential medicinal properties.
